comments:
In the method enableDelCommand (a method of the inner class focusListener), it
attempts to get and invoke a protected method called "setDefined" of the class
ICommandManager. This method no longer exists in Eclipse 3.1 so it throws
several exceptions coming up and everytime you select something in the graph of
beans view.
java.lang.NoSuchMethodException:
org.eclipse.ui.internal.commands.CommandWrapper.setDefined(boolean)
	at java.lang.Class.getDeclaredMethod(Class.java:1264)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.editorpart.JavaVisualEditorPart$3.enableDelCommand(JavaVisualEditorPart.java:1992)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.editorpart.JavaVisualEditorPart$3.focusGained(JavaVisualEditorPart.java:2001)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TypedListener.handleEvent(TypedListener.java:104)


For now I've commented out the calls to this method so it won't affect the
performance measurements by throwing exceptions. This in the focusGained and
focusLost methods of the focusListener. I put TODO's as part of the comments.
Joe... please look at and determine if any action or cleanup for M1.

Peter,
This fix looks good.  The old code was dealing with the fact that the
JavaVisualEditorPart had to re-direct the delete action towards whichever had
focus - the Java part or the GEF viewer.  I think we needed it once but it seems
to not be required any more.  I tested a number of combinations of delete using
the menu, the toolbar, the delete key with focus on the GEF viewer half or the
source editor, both in split pane and tabbed pane mode and they all seemed to
work OK so I've cleaned up the JavaVisualEditorPart to remove the code we don't
need any more.
